description: Tier 2 ClinVar→dosing heuristic rules for non-CPIC variants

rules.name: Strong Pathogenic Consensus
rules.description: ≥3 Pathogenic/Likely Pathogenic submissions with no Benign submissions
rules.rationale: Strong consensus for pathogenicity from multiple independent labs

rules.name: Very Strong Pathogenic (with conflicts)
rules.description: ≥5 Pathogenic submissions even if conflicts exist
rules.rationale: Very strong pathogenic signal (≥5 submissions) warrants dose reduction despite conflicts
rules.flag_reason: Conflicting interpretations present but strong pathogenic consensus

rules.name: Conflicting Evidence
rules.rationale: Conflicting evidence requires expert clinical judgment

rules.name: Single Pathogenic Submission
rules.rationale: Insufficient evidence for dosing change (single submission)
rules.note: No dosing adjustment recommended; evidence surfaced for clinician awareness

rules.name: Benign Consensus
rules.description: ≥3 Benign/Likely Benign submissions with no Pathogenic submissions

rules.name: VUS Only
rules.description: Only VUS (Uncertain Significance) submissions, no Pathogenic or Benign
rules.rationale: VUS status provides no actionable dosing guidance
rules.note: No dosing adjustment recommended; VUS status surfaced for clinician awareness

rules.name: Moderate Pathogenic (2 submissions)
rules.description: 2 Pathogenic/Likely Pathogenic submissions with no Benign
rules.rationale: Moderate pathogenic signal (2 submissions) warrants conservative dose reduction
rules.flag_reason: Limited evidence (2 submissions) - consider expert review

true_positive.definition: System recommended 'REDUCE_50' or 'REDUCE_25_FLAG' AND patient had Grade 3-5 toxicity

true_negative.definition: System recommended 'NO_ACTION' or 'SURFACE_EVIDENCE_ONLY' AND patient had Grade 0-2 or no toxicity

false_positive.definition: System recommended 'REDUCE_50' or 'REDUCE_25_FLAG' BUT patient had Grade 0-2 or no toxicity

false_negative.definition: System recommended 'NO_ACTION' or 'SURFACE_EVIDENCE_ONLY' BUT patient had Grade 3-5 toxicity

indeterminate.definition: System recommended 'FLAG_FOR_EXPERT_REVIEW' - cannot be scored as TP/TN/FP/FN
indeterminate.note: These cases should be analyzed separately

notes: These rules are heuristic and require clinical validation
FLAG recommendations require expert clinical judgment
SURFACE_EVIDENCE_ONLY means no dosing change but evidence is presented to clinician
